alert.note: Alert for Northern Humboldt Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued November 26 at 10:16AM PST until November 26 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Increased threat of sneaker waves expected. * WHERE...Northern Humboldt Coast County. * WHEN...Until 7 PM PST this evening.. . * IMPACTS...Large, unexpected waves can sweep across the beach without warning, sweeping people into the sea from rocks, jetties, and beaches. These sneaker waves can also move large objects such as logs, crushing anyone caught underneath.
info.instruction: Don`t be fooled by an ocean that looks calm. There can be 30 minutes of small waves before a sneaker wave strikes. Avoid rocks and jetties. Avoid steep beaches. Stay much farther back from the water and never turn your back on the ocean.
